section.title: Enter New Bill of Operations
section.para: To enter a new Bill of Operations, select the "Enter New Bill of Operations" option. The following screen will appear:
When creating a new Bill of Operations, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Item Number of the manufactured Item you want to create a Bill of Operations for.
Inventory Unit of Measure.

listitem.para: Expired Operations: Select to display expired Operations in the "Bill of Operations" display. Expired Operations are Operations that have been expired from the Bill of Operations.

listitem.para: Future Operations: Select to display future Operations in the "Bill of Operations" display. Future Operations are Operations that will be added to the Bill of Operations at a future point in time.
Enter text to describe the revision--if any.
If desired, enter a document number to further identify the Bill of Materials.
Indicates the date of the revision. This field updates every time the Bill of Operations is saved.

note.para: Once a revision date has been entered, the date field cannot be erased. The specific date may be updated to reflect subsequent revisions, but the field will never be null as long as the Bill of Materials exists.

work in process boo-defined locations for
bills of operations wip locations and Final Location

listitem.para: Select a final work-in-process (WIP) Location. This is an optional selection which may be used for tracking the Warehouse Locations of finished goods Inventory as it moves through the manufacturing process. The feature applies only to top-level, Multiple Location Control (MLC) Items whose production is posted through Work Order Operations posting. If you choose to track finished MLC goods using this feature, then the final Location is the Location where Inventory will be located when Operations posting for the Work Order is completed. If you do not wish to track WIP Locations for finished MLC goods, then you can ignore this option.

varlistentry.term:
bills of operations production lead times in
lead times in BOOs Production Lead Time

listitem.para: Lead Time: Displays production Lead Time for the specified Item. The production Lead Time value is equal to the maximum Execution Day value specified for listed Operations. Each Operation must have an Execution Day specified. Based on values entered for all listed Operations, whichever Execution Day value is the maximum, that value will be displayed as the production Lead Time for the Bill of Operations.

varlistentry.term: Close W/O when full Qty. Posted

listitem.para: Select to automatically close Work Orders when the full Work Order quantity is posted when posting Operations.
Display lists all Operations for the selected Bill of Operations.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Saves the new Bill of Operations to the master list of Bills of Operations.
Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.
Opens screen for creating a new Operation.

Enables you to edit highlighted Operations. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Operation--except that when editing, the fields will contain Operation information. Double-clicking on an Operation will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight an Operation and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight an Operation and then select this button to expire the Operation, causing it to be hidden from view on the list--unless the "Show Expired Operations" option is specifically chosen.

tip.para: If the Operation is expired on the current day, the Operation will still appear as an option when selecting "Used At" Operations on a Bill of Materials (BOM) if done during the same current day. Once a day passes, however, the expired Operation will no longer appear as a "Used At" option on the BOM.

listitem.para: Highlight an Operation and then select this button to move the Operation up the Bill of Operations list. Sequence numbers, which are incremented in multiples of ten, are automatically adjusted to reflect the change in position.

Highlight an Operation and then select this button to move the Operation down the Bill of Operations list. Sequence numbers, which are incremented in multiples of ten, are automatically adjusted to reflect the change in position.
